sen.j: 本多髷（ほんだまげ）とは江戸時代に粋人の間に流行した男髷。
sen.e: Hondamage is a male hairstyle that was popular among Suijin (men of refined tastes) during the Edo period.

sen.j: 令兄本多（わかさまほんだ）、金魚本多（きんぎょほんだ）、病本多（やまいほんだ）、浪速本多（なにわほんだ）、豆本多（まめほんだ）などさまざまな種類が登場した。
sen.e: There were many different types of Hondamage, such as Wakasamahonda, Kingyohonda, Yamaihonda, Naniwahonda, and Mamehonda.

sen.j: 耳の上ぎりぎりから側頭部にかけてまで極端に広く月代（さかやき）を取り、鬢の毛を簾のように纏め上げる。
sen.e: The front part of the head is extremely broadly shaved from the very edge of the ears to the temporal regions, and sidelocks are combed up like a bamboo blind.

sen.j: 鼠の尻尾のように細く作りなした髷は元結で高く結い上げて、急角度で頭頂部にたらすというもの。
sen.e: The topknot made thin like a rat's tail is tied up with a paper cord, hanging down sharply to the top of the head.

sen.j: 広い月代と頭と髷先、髷の根元を線で結んだ間の部分に空間ができるのが特徴。
sen.e: The characteristic of this hairstyle is a space enclosed by the line connecting the broad shaved part, the ends of the topknot, and the root of the topknot.

sen.j: 優美で柔和な印象で最初吉原 (東京都)に出入りする客の間で大人気を博した。
sen.e: This hairstyle looked so elegant and soft that it began to gain enormous popularity among frequent customers of Yoshiwara (a red-light district in Tokyo).

sen.j: 本多髷でなければ吉原遊郭では相手にされない、大店の若旦那といえば本多髷を結うものというようなステレオタイプまで存在した。
sen.e: There were the following stereotypes: a man without wearing Hondamage was received coolly in the Yoshiwara red light district; the mention of a young master of a large merchant house reminded people of wearing Hondamage.

sen.j: 江戸の粋人の出で立ちと言えば、粋な濃い茶系統か鼠色系統の絹物の小紋の衣装一式に本多髷だった。
sen.e: Suijin in Edo was commonly dressed in a complete outfit of fine-patterned silk kimono in chic dark brown or dark gray with Hondamage hairstyle.

sen.j: さりげなく南蛮や唐渡りの名物裂の袋に銀無垢の煙管を携えて、遊郭では静かに酒を飲んで冗談を楽しむという具合の御仁が人気だった。
sen.e: A gentleman, who would carry a solid silver tobacco pipe casually in a bag of a famed fabric imported from Spain and Portugal or China, and exchange jokes by drinking sake quietly, was especially poplar in Yoshiwara.

sen.e: Frankly speaking, the relationship between a customer and a prostitute is like a pseudo married couple in which a woman holds supremacy.

sen.e: When a customer had a relationship not with his regular partner but with another prostitute, his regular partner had a right to punish him.

sen.j: 大通りをザンバラ髪で歩いていればすぐに理由を悟られたため遊郭の中には浮気男専門の髪結いがいて、豆本多という小ぶりな髷に結いなおしてくれたという。
sen.e: When a man with his hair hanging loose and disheveled walked on the street, people might see what had happened to him, so each licensed quarter had a hairdresser particularly for playboys to rearrange their hair in a small topknot called Mamehonda.
